name: Azure Container Registry does not use a dedicated resource group
description:
Placing your Azure Container Registry (ACR) in a dedicated Azure resource group, allows you to minimize the risk of accidentally deleting the collection of images in the registry when you delete the container instance resource group.
This policy identifies ACRs that reside in resource groups that contains non-ACR resources. For more information about ACR best practices, visit https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/container-registry/container-registry-best-practices
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type='azure' and api.name= 'azure-container-registry'   as X; config from cloud.resource where api.name = 'azure-resource-group' as Y; filter ' $.X.resourceGroupName equals $.Y.name and $.Y.isDedicatedContainerRegistryGroup is false' ; show X;
recommendation:
To remediate this alert, move all non-ACR resources to another resource group.

For more information about moving resources to another security group, visit [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-group-move-resources|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/resource-group-move-resources]
compliance.standard: Australian Energy Sector Cyber Security Framework (AESCSF)
